comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: Taft attended a reception at City College in New York for Dr Alexis Carrel, who had won the Nobel Prize for medicine in 1912. The event took place on on Nov 16, 1912. The event was hosted by the President of the City College of New York Dr. John H. Finley. Perhaps the caption should read Dr. Finley not "D.R. Finley". Finley was the 3rd President of City College of NY, serving as President 1903 to 1913. Article from NYTimes describing the event honoring Dr. Carrel: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B07E5DE1E3AE633A... Article from Wikipedia about City College, mentioning its Presidents: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/City_College_of_New_York Article about Nobel Prize winner and honoree: Dr. Alexis Carrel (is he in the photo perhaps?) en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Carrel

comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: This article from NYT next day has photo from the big reception with caption identifying Dr. Carrel and also President Finley query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F0DE6DE1E3AE633A... and here is photo of Dr. Carrel, from this Flicker/LOC set: www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/2405656016/in/p...

comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: It does look as though it ought to be "Dr." Finley.  Thanks for noting it and for the clues as to the likely event.  We'll add the subject note!
